item.title: edX courses + time on campus = a new path to an MIT master's degree
item.description:
edX courses + time on campus = a new path to an MIT master's degree

MIT Pilot program reimagines admissions process, introduces "MicroMaster's." This story originally ran on MIT News. EdX co-founder and partner MIT announced today a pilot program allowing learners worldwide to take a semester's worth of courses in its top-ranked, one-year Supply Chain Management (SCM) master's program completely online, then complete an MIT master's degree by spending a single semester on campus.

item.title: 'Frontline' virtual-reality doc takes viewers into heart of Ebola outbreak
item.description:
'Frontline' virtual-reality doc takes viewers into heart of Ebola outbreak

In its first virtual-reality documentary, Frontline transports viewers to a spot under a towering tree in West Africa, believed to be the origination point for the Ebola virus that became a global health crisis last year.

item.title: Why storyboarding is important in elearning
item.description:
Why storyboarding is important in elearning

What is a storyboard? Should you use storyboards when you create elearning? Steve Penfold believes storyboarding can increase the efficiency of your elearning design and development process. Read on to discover four reasons why you should consider integrating storyboards into your elearning creation process.

item.title: Cultivating the IT Workforce of the Future
item.description:
Cultivating the IT Workforce of the Future

Scarcity of technical talent is a significant concern in many industries. Organizations are scrambling to find individuals skilled in emerging, disruptive technologies, and will likely need to cultivate a new species-the IT worker of the future-with habits, incentives, and skills inherently different from those in play today.
